title: Photographer uses peanut butter to capture charming dog passport pictures
text:
These cute dog were more than ready for their portraits by Frog Dog Studios

Nine canines pose in an experiment by Australian snappers to mimic dogs in passport photos.

Peanut butter was used to get the pooches’ attention – hence the lip-licking. And it made for a nice spread of pictures.

The adorable collection of images were taken to emulate human passport portraits.

If any these pooches are planning any holidays this year then their passport photos are sorted.

Photographer Belinda Richards, 39, from Melbourne, Australia, Creative Director of Frog Dog Studios, said: “Noises and peanut butter are our biggest secret in getting the subjects attention, a fun noise is key to getting that connection with the lens.

“Peanut butter should be in any pet photographer’s arsenal, dogs love it, it gets them to sit still for a couple of minutes while they lick so I can get a huge variety of different facial expressions.”
